column1: COVID-19 rates and cases are going up. 📈 Luckily we know how to stop the spread. Please wear your mask and practice social distancing. New data shows mask wearers are protected 70%+ of the time. By wearing a mask you are protecting yourself AND others. https://t.co/biRfOBoWk3

COVID cases are on the rise in Montgomery County — and across the state and country. We know what it takes to keep the numbers low: social distancing testing and tracing and wearing a mask.😷 Let's show we care about each other by taking precautions. https://t.co/Cc30OKTAbR

Now is your chance to ask questions in advance for our first ever Drive-in 🚙 Town Hall. I’m looking forward to speaking directly with you all & hearing about your concerns.   We will be following all COVID-19 guidelines & safety precautions.  https://t.co/7oxYo2lHfr

Everyone across @MontcoPA deserves credit for uniting in the effort to fight this virus. Continue taking proper precautions -- practice social distance and wear a mask. Thank you to our incredible Commissioners @VAArk & @kenlawrencejr for ably guiding us  https://t.co/1z5sTXyKym

HAPPENING NOW: I’m speaking with @WhipClyburn on FB live about the COVID-19 task force and protecting fair and free elections during a pandemic. Tune in on FB Live: https://t.co/cAvAX4sRQL https://t.co/yE2Vnp0OL9

Again @CDCgov warned us of COVID-19 spikes in the Fall. This is the administration’s latest attempt to deny science & deny the facts. Public access to data is key in combating this disease — sadly this deflection of the truth will have deadly consequences. https://t.co/956EzEZod9

It has been 59 days since the House passed the Heroes Act. While the Senate & @senatemajldr fail to act COVID-19 cases are surging.   This pandemic is not over. Healthcare workers need hazard pay and families need direct cash payments now. The Senate needs to act. https://t.co/pzvzO9g1jc

At today’s @FSCDems hearing we’ll discuss the challenges minority-owned businesses face — in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic. We must provide relief to those struggling the most. https://t.co/YeZmM5uplI
41% of Black-owned businesses closed permanently since the COVID-19 pandemic began. Join me on Facebook Live at 9AM as I discuss this issue with Black economic leaders. https://t.co/NLTQcvHJ8L

As COVID-19 cases skyrocket across the nation I am disappointed that @HHSGov  would irresponsibly end Fed funding for community testing sites. I am certain @MontcoPA will step up to serve the roughly 300 people per day that need COVID-19 testing.  https://t.co/D1rDx6flRd
Don’t feed into the fear-mongering.   I just cast my vote by mail — and the process was safe and secure. I was able to social distance and exercise my right — it’s a win-win. https://t.co/Q08oDGoXUX

People are struggling to make rent because of COVID-19. This is not their fault and we cannot allow this pandemic to be the reason tenants are evicted — it will have adverse effects on their mental health credit score and future.   https://t.co/oqxlh0pxdB
Thank you @BWilliams and @NicolleDWallace for allowing me to talk about the toll COVID-19 is taking on families across this country — including my own. https://t.co/SNd9DO1toL
HAPPENING NOW: I’m speaking with @RepRoKhanna on Instagram Live! We’re discussing COVID-19 and its impact on students & student borrowers.   https://t.co/OQnjHl36f6

Bold action like more direct cash payments to individuals like @RepDonBeyer and I have proposed: $2000 payments to Americans tied to the longevity of this #COVID19 crisis. See more about the proposal below ⬇️ https://t.co/zwd3TSdoKf

🎓Our student loan crisis predates the #COVID19 outbreak and is only worsened by this pandemic. I introduced legislation giving relief to millions of borrowers that mirrors Senate legislation led by @SenWarren @SenSherrodBrown and Sen. @PattyMurray.  https://t.co/eksdG91GUZ

🏢The #COVID19 pandemic could bankrupt some of our smallest businesses and we must provide support now. @RepDerekKilmer and I introduced the Restore America’s Main Street Act which would provide direct cash grants to small businesses for the first-ever.  https://t.co/vtDVXRk5nm

💵 A one-time $1200 payment is not enough. @RepDonBeyer and I outlined a robust proposal to provide Americans with direct cash support coinciding with the longevity of the #COVID19 crisis.   https://t.co/CobU1KdcXj
COVID-19 took my beloved mother-in-law Joan Cunnane early this morning. Truth is Joanie was more than my in-law; she was a friend a mother an understanding older sister. https://t.co/SfklyyT5JH

Labor rights are human rights. The COVID-19 pandemic has highlighted the importance of our workers — they keep our shelves stocked and deliver our mail. We need to stand up for these folks — it’s not enough to say Thank You. Workers need fair pay and adequate protections #MayDay

We need sufficient testing and contact tracing to stop the spread of COVID-19 and accurately assess the case count.   I joined 60+ Reps. to demand answers from this administration.   Thank you @RepDonBeyer for your leadership! https://t.co/1SaejEtper

Today I hosted a video conference with advocates for those with disabilities.   COVID-19 has impacted early intervention at-home care and more.   I look forward to continuing this discussion & ensuring that folks with disabilities receive adequate education care and support.
Tune into @onwurd I am on with @ellisonreport now to discuss the COVID-19 outbreak and the economic fallout.

Because of the COVID-19 outbreak we are unable to host the congressional art competition. If you were working on a piece — please share your work here using #TheMDeanCollection to share your great work. To kick it off here's a great piece painted by my Chief of Staff at age 6 👩‍🎨 https://t.co/fSJkIO3V5R

Relieved to hear that because of the CARES Act the Community Health and Dental Care in Pottstown received $672005 to address costs associated with COVID-19. Funding will cover treatment costs and will help address COVID-19 cases in @pottstownboro.
Protect yourself and others from the spread of coronavirus. Let's try wearing a mask when we leave our homes. https://t.co/BPlYEK5YVV

I'm back home in Jenkintown and I urge everyone that can stay home to stay home — it makes us all safer! It's a great time to fill out the 2020 Census cook a special recipe or touch your yoga mat. Let's keep up this social distance and flatten the curve. https://t.co/Btto0MbpCT

I was so inspired to join @NorristownASD this morning and distribute meal packages.   Our communities have united to ensure no child goes hungry during the COVID-19 outbreak.   In Montgomery and Berks counties we know we are all in this together. 💪🏽 #NASDProud #PA04 https://t.co/4r3HNsTwsT

Let’s call it COVID-19 or Coronavirus that’s it. Recent discrimination against Asian-Americans is xenophobic and shameful. Let’s find strength in our humanity and kindness during this difficult time. We are all in this together.

Folks need student loan relief now. This proposal gives relief to millions who are dealing with student loan debt as we manage the economic fallout from #COVID19   Thank you @SenWarren @SenSchumer @PattyMurray @SenSherrodBrown for your work on this.  https://t.co/Gx7ra3Okhw

10 years ago the Affordable Care Act expanded health coverage to 20 million people.  In the midst of the #COVID19 outbreak we need to protect the ACA more than ever and build upon its effort to ensure Americans do not choose between their health and bankruptcy. #ACA  #ACA10 https://t.co/u52xvPh6u7

Due to the #COVID19 outbreak and its economic impact Americans are struggling to stay afloat. The stimulus package must work #ForThePeople no exceptions.   American workers and businesses need relief now — not corporate bailouts or a secret slush fund @senatemajldr.
REMINDER: Our Telephone Town Hall on the #COVID19 coronavirus begins in 4 minutes.  Join us now at https://t.co/EHJDgNbgod https://t.co/JARMVOjjkp

We must protect @SEPTA from the devastating effects of the #COVID19 outbreak. Our public transportation system is vital to the economy of Pennsylvania. Thank you @RepDwightEvans and @RepBrianFitz for leading this effort.   https://t.co/dsr5JxS7sr

The economic impact of the #COVID19 outbreak is enormous. Tonight we will host a Telephone Town Hall on how the state and federal government can assist displaced workers and businesses during this tough time.  Sign up here➡️ https://t.co/arLSLcYBaW https://t.co/NmjRHub4y3

BREAKING: Due to COVID-19 the tax filing deadline has been moved from April 15 to July 15 for those who owe less than $1 million.  Taxpayers and businesses will have this additional time to file and make payments without interest or penalties.  https://t.co/B5LdnZZnnU

This is a necessary step to slow the spreading of #COVID19  Please know that we are working tirelessly to help hardworking Pennsylvanians & business owners during this difficult time.   We are in this together.  See our resource page➡️https://t.co/H75wHPj7UF https://t.co/b2EhYFbThS

The @SBAgov has rightfully declared the state of Pennsylvania an economic disaster. This will expand support for small businesses suffering during the #COVID19  outbreak.  Check out our guidance for businesses applying for these loans⬇️ https://t.co/7r9igpj3Sx

During this public health crisis — let’s all take advantage of the new Pennsylvania vote by mail system. We can practice democracy and continue our efforts to slow the spread of COVID-19.  Apply here:  https://t.co/1T7W3mLecH

I am deeply saddened by the death of the first Pennsylvanian from COVID-19.  I am praying for the deceased and their family at this time of such extraordinary loss.   May they be comforted knowing that so many people across this commonwealth care about their loss.  #COVID19 https://t.co/sfAGHFaCRA

1️⃣ Families’ health security: ensuring free coronavirus testing for everyone who needs a test including the uninsured. And increase funding for Medicaid to support local state tribal & territorial health systems so that they have needed resources to combat #COVID19 (2/5)

I am pleased the Senate joined the House in passing the Families First Coronavirus Response Act — a bill that prioritizes American families’ in these three important ways. (1/5)  https://t.co/GMvPnhZscb

Let’s take a moment to thank our police fire and healthcare workers as they continue to provide us with essential services during the #COVID19 outbreak. We are grateful for your service! 🦸🏽‍♂️🦸🏻‍♀️ https://t.co/4lbiZh4Uac

➡️If you are a Pennsylvania worker and unable to work because of COVID-19 you may be eligible for Unemployment or Workers' Compensation benefits.  See more details in the link below:  https://t.co/DW2ybSsRSj

👉 @HouseDemocrats are working to pass legislation to relieve hard-working Americans during the COVID-19 outbreak. Please see the breakdown below and urge your Senators and White House to pass and sign this relief package.   #FamiliesFirst https://t.co/kPNg5cbaoC

🚨 ALERT 🚨  Due to CDC and @GovernorTomWolf's recommendations regarding the COVID19 outbreak all of our offices will be closed until further notice.  Staff will be tele-working -- we recommend all inquiries be directed at https://t.co/5KVcq6P4gv. https://t.co/ApKghOpHeH

Thank you to the 6000+ participants for joining last night's Telephone Town Hall about COVID-19. I appreciate the local state and federal health officials including @VAArk who offered informative insights.
Join us tonight at 7:50 PM for a Telephone Town Hall about the status of COVID-19! Public health officials will be available to answer your questions.  Call 866-416-5212 to join the conversation.

Please remember to stay home and call your doctor if you are feeling unwell. Social distancing measures help us avoid spreading coronavirus to others. Your vigilance keeps our community healthy!   https://t.co/6x42v6m1zs
Join us tomorrow night at 7:50 PM for a Telephone Town Hall about the status of CO-VID 19.  Call 866-416-5212 to join the conversation.☎️💬  #COVID2019 https://t.co/SBMLfoOW96
Please tune into @PAHealthDept's press conference on the latest information about the coronavirus (#COVID19) as well as recommended safety precautions.  ⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️  https://t.co/LVa2u44hEz

2 more cases of the coronavirus were announced in @MontcoPA on Saturday.  The 2 new cases are in isolation at home.  Stay safe remember to wash hands regularly limit travel and if you are feeling Ill get checked. We are continuing to monitor the situation. https://t.co/qjNvnO8rXu

With the possibility of Coronavirus in PA it is of the utmost importance to take extra precautions to prevent the spread of this virus. Make sure you stay up-to-date with @PAHealthDept and take simple steps:  1. Wash your hands  2. Avoid touching your face 3. Stay home when sick https://t.co/VxOQMV74hO

Yesterday the House passed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act providing $8.3 billion in emergency funds. These funds are critical to preventing and combating the #COVID19 virus from spreading. We must keep Americans safe. https://t.co/jIFHlFjRwt

To prevent the spread of #COVID19. The CDC suggests:  🙅‍♀️Avoid close contact w/people who are sick 👏Avoid touching your eyes nose & mouth 🏠Stay home when you are sick 🤧Cover your cough or sneeze w/ a tissue then throw tissue in the trash  https://t.co/ZfRqaUQyLS
